entity.name: `<svg>` (Inline SVG)
entity.description: Embed SVG vector graphics directly in markup
entity.descriptionClean: Embed SVG vector graphics directly in markup
entity.descriptionHtml: Embed SVG vector graphics directly in markup

mdn.title: <svg>
mdn.summary: The <svg> SVG element is a container that defines a new coordinate system and viewport. It is used as the outermost element of SVG documents, but it can also be used to embed an SVG fragment inside an SVG or HTML document.

example.codeHighlighted: <svg> <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="50" /> </svg>

webFeature.description_html: The SVG image format, represented by the <svg> element, creates two-dimensional vector graphics with declarative or scripted interaction and animation.
webFeature.name: SVG

entity.name: `<canvas>`
entity.description: Element for drawing dynamic 2D or 3D graphics using JavaScript.
entity.descriptionClean: Element for drawing dynamic 2D or 3D graphics using JavaScript.
entity.descriptionHtml: Element for drawing dynamic 2D or 3D graphics using JavaScript.

mdn.title: <canvas>: The Graphics Canvas element
mdn.summary: Use the HTML <canvas> element with either the canvas scripting API or the WebGL API to draw graphics and animations.

webFeature.description_html: The <canvas> HTML element is a space to draw graphics in, using the 2D canvas API, WebGL, or WebGPU.
webFeature.name: <canvas>

entity.name: `colorSpace` for 2D canvas
entity.description: Set the color space for the graphics being drawn on a  `<canvas>` element.
entity.descriptionClean: Set the color space for the graphics being drawn on a  <canvas> element.
entity.descriptionHtml: Set the color space for the graphics being drawn on a <canvas> element.

mdn.title: HTMLCanvasElement: getContext() method
mdn.summary: The HTMLCanvasElement.getContext() method returns a drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context identifier is not supported, or the canvas has already been set to a different context mode.

example.codeHighlighted: const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d", {colorSpace: "display-p3"});

resources.title: Wide Gamut 2D Graphics using HTML Canvas | WebKit

webFeature.description_html: The optional colorSpace parameter of a 2D canvas's getContext() method chooses the color representation, such as "srgb" or "display-p3".
webFeature.name: Color management for 2D canvas

entity.name: `ctx.drawElement()` (HTML in canvas)
entity.description: Draw an HTML element on `<canvas>`,  with conveniences for redrawing and hit testing.
entity.descriptionClean: Draw an HTML element on <canvas>,  with conveniences for redrawing and hit testing.
entity.descriptionHtml: Draw an HTML element on <canvas>, with conveniences for redrawing and hit testing.

example.code: Hello world!
example.codeHighlighted: <canvas id="canvas" layoutsubtree="true"> <p>Hello world!</p> </canvas> <script type="module"> const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d"); const text = canvas.querySelector("p"); ctx.drawElement(text, 30, 0); </script>

entity.name: `<model>` (Inline AR/VR/3D content)
entity.description: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.
entity.descriptionHtml: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.

resources.title: AR, VR, and a Model for 3D in HTML | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Safari Technology Preview 137 Release Notes | Apple Developer Documentation

entity.name: `navigator.xr` (WebXR Device API)
entity.description: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionHtml: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.

mdn.title: WebXR Device API
mdn.summary: WebXR is a group of standards which are used together to support rendering 3D scenes to hardware designed for presenting virtual worlds (virtual reality, or VR), or for adding graphical imagery to the real world, (augmented reality, or AR). The WebXR Device API implements the core of the WebXR feature set, managing the selection of output devices, render the 3D scene to the chosen device at the appropriate frame rate, and manage motion vectors created using input controllers.

example.code:
const xr = navigator.xr;
const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");
example.codeHighlighted: const xr = navigator.xr; const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.xr API represents the browser's virtual reality or augmented reality system. You can use to request a WebXR session.
webFeature.name: WebXR

entity.name: WebGPU
entity.description: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionClean: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionHtml: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.

mdn.title: WebGPU API
mdn.summary: The WebGPU API enables web developers to use the underlying system's GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) to carry out high-performance computations and draw complex images that can be rendered in the browser.

example.code:
const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();
const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();
example.codeHighlighted: const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter(); const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();

resources.title: WebGPU: Unlocking modern GPU access in the browser

entity.name: WebGL
entity.description: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on `<canvas>` , based on OpenGL.
entity.descriptionClean: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.
entity.descriptionHtml: A low-level API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics with the GPU on <canvas> , based on OpenGL.

mdn.title: Getting started with WebGL
mdn.summary: WebGL enables web content to use an API based on OpenGL ES 2.0 to perform 2D and 3D rendering in an HTML canvas in browsers that support it without the use of plug-ins.

webFeature.description_html: The WebGLRenderingContext API is the "webgl" rendering context for the <canvas> element. It represents a space for drawing two- and three-dimensional graphics and animations.
webFeature.name: WebGL

entity.name: JPEG XL
entity.description: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionClean: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionHtml: An image format optimized for web environments.

webFeature.description_html: The JPEG XL image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
webFeature.name: JPEG XL
